page.title: 07TOURISM IN LYME REGIS
page.content: In Lyme Regis (known as the "Pearl of Dorset") tourism is the main source of revenue and jobs, chiefly in the summer season. Lyme contains twelve licensed hotels (three three-star), thirteen guest houses, much self-catering accommodation and numerous cafes and restaurants to cater for the mainly English, Dutch, German and American tourists. They came to see the stone breakwater, the Cobb; the four beaches, local fossils, the World Champion Town Crier, the annual summer Regatta and Carnival and Lifeboat Week and the location used in the internationally - shown film "The French Lieutenant's Woman." Lyme's 3,000+ winter population more than doubles in the summer, helped by very good and consistent media coverage of the 'town'.
